content:
1. In the Goal section, "eating 1 piece of some food" → "eating [[a]] pieces of some food"?
2. What is the answer to the test case below?
1
1 3 4

If his health decreases before eating some food, he is dead. Or not, he isn't dead (the answer is 2).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a great contribution

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: That was cool!
for clash its a quite good question, everything was considered and i can understand problem statement well, so its simple and nice.

Goal section
* I suggest to delete "If" and change the comma after [[G]] to a full-stop.
* Please change "Health" to "health".
* Please the comma after "food".
* Please change "Will grasshopper" to "Will the grasshopper".
* Please also add "the" before "grasshopper" in the note, and change "pieces" to "amount" there too.
* Please change "the ant" (1st paragraph) and "ant" (in the note) to "the ants".

Input section
* Please change "First/Second line contains" to "<<Line 1/2:>>".
* Please add "space-separated" between "three" and "integers".

Variable names
* Please be consistent - either use [[G]] or [[g]].

Test cases
* Easy 2 and Hard 2 are inconsistent with the constraint 2 ≤ a ≤ 20.
* Binary output should be avoided according to the contribution guidelines:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/contribute---help/contribution-guidelines
In your case, only "true" or "false" are the possible outputs, so it has the issue of binary output. I'd suggest to change the clash to require an output of a calculated amount for the "true" cases.

Thanks.
I understood the topic. It's quite simple. But you did a great job.

1. For example, if the ants have given the grasshopper 7 pieces of food, the grasshopper's health will increase by 1 after eating 1 piece of food given by the ants.

2. He will be dead, cuz, his health decreases before eating the food

Thanks for the changes. The clash is better now! A few more touches:

Goal section
* Please change "the ant" to "the ants".
* Please change the comma before "Day" to a full-stop.
* Please delete "find that (line break) - Output" and change that to "output". That means the revised sentence becomes "... is to output ...".

Input section
* Please format "Line 1/2:" as bold by enclosing them within << and >>, e.g. <<Line 1:>>.
* Please delete "contains".
* Please change "three-integers" to "three space-separated integers".
* I would suggest to make the Line 2 description clearer with the following layout:
Line 2: three space-separated integers [[g]], [[e]] and [[a]], where:
[[g]] is the health of the grasshopper
[[e]] is (etc)
[[a]] is the amount (etc)
* Again please use "amount" instead of "pieces" here.

Output section
* Please remember to always state the variable type. So I suggest to change it as
An integer for the health of the grasshopper, or a string {{Dead}}

Thanks again.

Hmmm, it looks like some changes have been missing?

Goal section
* I suggest to merge the two lines as a single line, so:
Now your task is to find the health of the grasshopper after [[d]] days. If his health is below or equal to 0, output {{Dead}}
* Also, a full-stop instead of comma after "days" as shown above.

Input section
* Please change "three-integers" to "three space-separated integers".
* I would suggest to make the Line 2 description clearer with the following layout:
Line 2: three space-separated integers [[g]], [[e]] and [[a]], where:
[[g]] is the health of the grasshopper
[[e]] is (etc)
[[a]] is the amount (etc)

Thank you.

OK! I have found 2 more changes needed, and I think I am done for now :P

Output section - add "remaining" before "health".

Stub generator - change "true" to something else.

Many thanks!
thank you so much 5DN1L for helping!
